decks.notes: This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through counterspells and removal while gaining card advantage through cards like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. The deck also utilizes powerful artifacts like Moxen and Urza's Saga to ramp up quickly and control the game with efficient threats like Psychic Frog and Nethergoyf. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds a recurring threat to the deck's arsenal. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in a one-on-one Vintage setting.

This deck revolves around assembling the game-winning combo of Doomsday and Thassa's Oracle, utilizing various card draw and tutor effects to set up the perfect stack of cards. With a mix of efficient counterspells, fast mana, and cantrips, the deck aims to quickly dig through the library to find and cast Doomsday to win the game on the spot with Thassa's Oracle. The deck is designed to be fast and consistent, aiming to win the game before opponents have a chance to disrupt the combo.

The deck is focused on using fast mana sources and disruptive elements to create a fast and efficient storm combo utilizing cards like Gush, Chrome Mox, and Archon of Emeria. The deck aims to lock down opponent's resources while casting multiple spells in a single turn to overwhelm the opponent and win the game quickly. The inclusion of hate cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Chalice of the Void further hinders opponents' ability to respond effectively, giving the deck a strong advantage in the early and mid-game.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana through artifacts such as Urza's Saga, Mishra's Workshop, and Grim Monolith, while utilizing cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Coveted Jewel to draw cards and gain advantage. The key strategy is to set up a powerful board state quickly and efficiently, allowing the player to combo off with cards like Tinker and Time Vault for a quick win. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Force of Will and Sink into Stupor to control the game and protect its combo pieces.

This deck focuses on utilizing artifacts to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying aggressive threats. By leveraging powerful artifact mana sources like Mishra's Workshop and the Moxen, the deck can quickly ramp into threats such as Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Lodestone Golem. Crucible of Worlds and Wasteland provide additional disruption, allowing the deck to control the opponent's resources. The inclusion of cards like Sphere of Resistance and Chalice of the Void further hinders the opponent's ability to cast spells effectively, while cards like Thorn of Amethyst and Trinisphere slow down the opponent's game plan even more.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifact-based acceleration to ramp into powerful threats and disrupt the opponent with taxing effects like Sphere of Resistance and Trinisphere. By combining aggressive creatures like Lodestone Golem and Nettlecyst with disruptive cards like Null Rod and Thorn of Amethyst, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly while also utilizing cards like Crucible of Worlds and Strip Mine to control the board. The key strategy is to establish an early advantage and press it aggressively to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on generating a high amount of mana through artifacts like Mishra's Workshop and Mana Crypt, while also utilizing cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Grim Monolith to draw cards and recur artifacts. The key strategy revolves around creating a combo using cards like Tinker to search for specific artifacts like Time Vault or Coveted Jewel, enabling powerful plays and overwhelming the opponent with a strong board presence. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Trinisphere to control the pace of the game and protect its combo pieces.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly using artifacts like Mishra's Workshop, Grim Monolith, and The One Ring to power out combos and powerful spells. The key strategy involves using Paradoxical Outcome to bounce back and replay multiple artifacts for card advantage and ramp. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Trinisphere and Force of Will to control the game. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces needed to win the game efficiently while outpacing and outmaneuvering the opponent.

The deck focuses on using artifacts like Coveted Jewel, Mishra's Workshop, and Urza's Saga to generate significant mana advantage. This allows the player to cast powerful spells like Paradoxical Outcome, Tinker, and Karn, the Great Creator to establish a dominating board presence. The deck also includes key pieces like Time Vault and Manifold Key to create infinite turns. Force of Will and Trinisphere help protect the combo while cards like Sensei's Divining Top and Phyrexian Metamorph provide additional utility and resilience. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with overwhelming card advantage and board control.

The deck focuses on a fast and aggressive strategy by utilizing powerful Merfolk creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The key concept revolves around generating early mana advantage with powerful artifact accelerators like Mana Crypt, Sol Ring, and Moxen, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Will and Grafdigger's Cage. The Merfolk creatures, such as Tide Shaper and Tishana's Tidebinder, provide additional disruption and tempo advantage, allowing the deck to maintain pressure and control the game. Ultimately, the deck aims to win through a combination of efficient creature beats and disruption spells.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting opponents with a mix of counter spells, removal, and card advantage. The key strategy is to control the board through efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and counterspells like Force of Will, while maintaining card advantage with draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. The deck also utilizes the graveyard as a resource with cards like Thought Scour and Treasure Cruise. With a solid mana base and access to powerful spells, this deck aims to outlast opponents and grind out wins through attrition.

The deck revolves around generating a large amount of mana to fuel explosive combos using cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Time Vault. It combines artifacts like Mishra's Workshop and Urza's Saga with fast mana sources and card draw to quickly assemble key pieces such as The One Ring. By efficiently using cards like Phyrexian Metamorph and Vexing Bauble, the deck aims to create powerful synergies and overwhelm opponents with its combo potential. The inclusion of disruptive elements like Force of Will and Trinisphere helps protect the combo and stall opponents, allowing the deck to execute its game plan effectively.

The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy by playing hatebears and aggro creatures while also having access to powerful mana acceleration to overwhelm the opponent quickly. It also includes cards that can provide card advantage and removal to deal with threats efficiently. The deck's key strategy revolves around utilizing hatebear creatures like Archon of Emeria and Anointed Peacekeeper to slow down the opponent's game plan, while also having the capability to put pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Seasoned Dungeoneer and White Plume Adventurer.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on using powerful and efficient spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while steadily building card advantage. With a suite of counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, along with removal spells such as Fatal Push and Orcish Bowmasters, the deck aims to control the board and prevent the opponent from executing their strategy. Cards like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time provide card advantage, while key artifacts like Time Vault and Manifold Key offer additional ways to win the game. The deck's goal is to outvalue and outtempo the opponent to secure victory.

Utilize artifacts and powerful blue spells to generate mana and draw cards quickly. Use Paradoxical Outcome to return artifacts to hand for more value, while also utilizing cards like Tinker, Time Vault, and Karn, the Great Creator for additional combo opportunities. Control the game with counterspells like Force of Will and disrupt opponents with cards like Trinisphere and Sink into Stupor. Take advantage of Mishra's Workshop and Urza's Saga to generate even more mana and create a formidable board presence. Ultimately, overwhelm opponents with a powerful artifact-based combo strategy.

This deck focuses on generating fast mana with Mishra's Workshop and Grim Monolith, while using Paradoxical Outcome to draw cards and produce a massive amount of mana. The key feature of the deck is to use Urza's Saga and Coveted Jewel to create a powerful combo with ManaVault and ManaCrypt, enabling a quick win using Tinker to fetch Time Vault and the necessary untap effects. The deck also includes cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Mystic Forge to provide additional utility and card advantage in order to support the combo strategy.
